lexUnit.name: enthrall.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: capture the fascinated attention of

sentence.text: Introduced by Mr J Smyth of the SWSHAS , Mr Martin Davies of Harrogate enthralled his audience with a most interesting talk and slide show .
During the evening , the Central Band of the RAF entertained the assembly with their marching display , and Dame Vera Lynn enthralled all present with songs from the war years .
And last night he enthralled fans from six to sixty with a brilliant set of old and new numbers , cleverly arranged and expertly put together .
On occasion marvellous phrases sprang out of his mouth and enthralled the audience .
The electric toaster which turned itself off when the toast was done and the electric beater enthralled her .
By then the subject-matter had enthralled me , and I shall not say that I felt more loving .

He was enthralled by the entire proceeding and remarked that only the English could make a contest between two crews which would not rank in the World 's top 10 into a bigger spectacle than the Olympic final .
I was enthralled by the emptiness .
Along the way you will be enthralled by the realistic recreation of everyday life in the Middle Ages and entertained by your fellow pilgrims .
Up to now she had been so enthralled by the adventure that , despite being clad in only a cotton shirt and slacks , she had hardly noticed the cold .
Gould was enthralled by the spirit and customs of the Aborigines , and above all their almost religious respect for nature and its creatures .
Edward was enthralled ; he leaned his head on his hands and gazed .
However , his scrap with brother Joey enthralled the crowd and at the finish they came over the line almost together .
This magic creature enthralled me and I cajoled until kind hands lifted me into the saddle .
One day we sat there enthralled by Hiroshima Mon Amour .
I realised why I was wrong about good theatre , about how it can enthrall in a way cinema and television rarely does .
Meredith flung him an eager glance , enthralled by the noise , the snow , the funereal gondolas bobbing in the water .
